column5: Well it's definitely outdoor related. Deer antler supplied by a dear friend (as well as one of my machine lathes) for his next custom rod build. 	This is the progress so far.......
That looks great, how many hours you figure to complete it?
There's about 3 hours in the reel seat and butt cap.
Looking forward to seeing the completed rod.
This part of the seat will be the signature . You could of turned the whole thing down and just had bone, but with this left, that is very very cool. Really really like that Chris. Fly rod ?
Thanks Brian. It's going to be strapped to a 13' CTS float rod.
Very impressive on how you got the portion of untouched antler to showcase the seat. Will you ever get the aroma of burnt bone out of the shop?
Thanks Pal. I get lucky sometimes and the stink, well I can assure you, you don't get used to it.  lol
